```{r}
#this will be different for each user so might need to reformat to test/run
data = read.csv("~/Desktop/github/Stat337FP/breast-cancer.txt")
as.integer(data$X30.34)
data[data$left_low == '?',]$left_low = NA
data[data$no == '?',]$no = NA
colnames(data) = c(
  "reoccurance",
  "age",
  "meno",
  "tmsize",
  "invnodes",
  "nodecaps",
  "maldeg",
  "breast",
  "quad",
  "irradiat"
)
str(data)
#the str funciton shows which variables are ints to be used in a chi squared
#chisq.test(data)
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,2]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,3]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,4]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,5]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,6]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,7]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,8]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,9]))
chisq.test(table(data[,1],data[,10]))
#wasn't sure which variables to use specifically with the recurrence events so I went with all of them

#student's t test compares the two

lr = glm(reoccurance ~., data = data, family = binomial(logit))
summary(lr)
```
